website_summaries.verdict: There's really no reason for anyone to get this smart lock.
pros: With no place to put a key, the Yale Assure smart lock effectively eliminates the threat of someone breaking in using a lockpick or a bump key
cons: The Assure trots out the same, stale design we've seen from Yale for years now, and makes you pay extra to add in Z-Wave, ZigBee or Apple HomeKit compatibility
Yale's app charges you $2 a digital key after the first five, and won't let you lock the door remotely or even see its current status
The "Twist N' Go" feature that lets you use the app at your door to get in seems completely pointless

customer_reviews.title: Overall good product. It works with the Echo Plus (and ...
customer_reviews.text: Overall good product. It works with the Echo Plus (and other smart hubs) for locking only, not unlocking (yet). My complaints are, the phone app to unlock the phone is super clunky and hard to use... I just use my code every time. Also, I was hoping for something more hands free. Perhaps a connection with the phone that allows an unlock from the car when it's cold and rainy (more like the keyless entry in my car). It does look sleek and clean, and so far (6 weeks in) the batteries are holding up. Installation was relatively easy for a moderately handy person.
customer_reviews.author: Christian B Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware
customer_reviews.text: While the lock functioned normally for a while, the display stopped working within a couple months. Yale support is a joke, I've been waiting nearly a year for a replacement, and e-mail support "doesn't have access to order status" so you get to call and sit and hold. I'm on hold with them now after being hung up on by the first rep I got through to. So now I have a security device that doesn't work, and when I do finally get a replacement I'll get to pay a locksmith again to come out, re-key it to match the other locks, and install it. I do not recommend this company's products.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin

customer_reviews.title: They work great and no more extra keys to keep
customer_reviews.text: Love this lock. As for as the app goes, it is ok and good for adding codes but not great for unlocking a door. Didn't get the module but now wish I had since I could then use this to lock away from the door itself or insure it is locked while away. Can add the module and likely will soon. I have this on a building across the street from my home for RV storage and shop and wanting to get more now for my home. They work great.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Dale A. Stagg

customer_reviews.title: The twist & go is not necessary
customer_reviews.text: I love the yale smartlock. They are very welcome designed and modern looking. It is easy to install as a replacement of dead bolt. The set up is easy and clean. However, the twist & go feature for the smartphone is completely unnecessary. This feature is unintelligible and difficult to use. Yale is also charging for you to have additional digital keys (>4) for $1.99! It works with the smart thing hub and amazon Lexi.
customer_reviews.author: Kiteman

customer_reviews.title: Best Smart Lock that i've tested so far...
customer_reviews.text: I've tested a Quikset, a Schlage and a Yale. So far, Yale is the best, with the Apple Homekit Integration. Easy to install, easy to integrate with Apple HomeKit (as long as you have the adapter included). Don't have any complaints. The only thing missing is a better iOS app experience. (Yale lost a star right there). Still, my app is not iPhone Xr compatible.
customer_reviews.author: Roque Junior

customer_reviews.title: App Store reviews tell it all--only reliable from the keypad,not your phone
customer_reviews.text: App Store reviews tell it all--only reliable from the keypad,not your phone. The Google Play Store rates the Yale App at 1.7/5 which I'd call generous. The Samsung Gear Store rates is a 1/5, the lowest possible score. The basic keypad lock is OK, but the Bluetooth and Z-Wave one is worthless without a robust app. This isn't a video game, it's your house in play.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Cousins

customer_reviews.title: Like it, I chose it because it does longer ...
customer_reviews.text: Like it, I chose it because it does longer codes, 4 digits seems to short to be secure. I do wish I had some way to open it when I have my hands full of groceries like with a fob or something, but I didn't like other features of the ones that had that. I do like that you can lock it when you leave with just putting the back of your hand across it. The auto locking is nice too and that you can set how long it waits to lock.
customer_reviews.author: Sol K.

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts from seller.
customer_reviews.text: Parts were missing. Item was previously opened and not properly repackaged. No striker plate for door jamb in box, no chip for door to be programmed.
customer_reviews.author: D. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Do not purchase from this vendor
customer_reviews.text: The verbage below is copied from the item description on Amazon. Yale Security YRD446ZW2619 YRD446-ZW2-619 Real Living Key Free Assure Touchscreen Deadbolt with Bluetooth and Z-Wave, Satin Nickel. The vendor states it is not Bluetooth and z wave. Do not purchase from this vendor
customer_reviews.author: Happy roadrunner

customer_reviews.title: I’ll never get anything else.
customer_reviews.text: Kind of weird instructions to program it but it works with Alexa perfectly. This has made leaving the house wondering if you locked door anxiety free. Can lock the door from the store or another country.
customer_reviews.author: ben

customer_reviews.title: “Follow Instructions carefully on install and programming”.
customer_reviews.text: Lock had to be assembled and installed on exterior door, if following instructions not difficult to do. The somewhat difficult part was in programming the Yale lock. Needed to contact Yale customer service to complete and test lock, after programming lock performed as illustrated in instructions. Offers a very high degree of security. It is battery operated, which I’m sure will last a long time (four AA’s)
customer_reviews.author: Robert DiBerardino

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work
customer_reviews.text: Horrible, the whole point was to connect with SmartThings. After hours of being on the phone with customer service and trying EVERYTHING for both smartthings and Yale, they had no answer as to why it would only connect and then get stuck on “checking status”. Exchanged it and still had the same issue. Couldn’t control anything with the smartthings app or even the Yale app! They said the Yale app was having issues too and didn’t know when it’d be fixed. Bought a Schlage and it worked awesome and took 5min to install and connect!
customer_reviews.author: Gabriela Borges

customer_reviews.title: Great electronic lock
customer_reviews.text: Great lock- mediocre app. The lock was easy to install and functions as designed- I find it to be convenient to use and overall a good value. I do not like the app though- cannot get the lock to accept some setting that are designed to be transferred by the app. They just sent out an update so we will see....
customer_reviews.author: R. Welch

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking... Easy installation
customer_reviews.text: So far I love it. I had previously installed a very expensive Samsung door lock. After less than a year it failed so I bought this to replace it. The installation was incredibly easy... Code set up super easy. Haven't set up the z-wave feature or unlock from phone but everything else has been a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: dixie

customer_reviews.title: Battery life is great, features are great
customer_reviews.text: I have had 3 Yales now. Battery life is great, features are great, as is integration with SmartThings. There are occasional hiccups, but this likely can be attributed to SmartThings indoor connectivity. Remember to purchase zwave extenders if you're having distance problems. It makes a big difference.
customer_reviews.author: gb_ott

customer_reviews.title: easy to instal but not recommended
customer_reviews.text: good things: easy to install bad things: batteries dont last, connection with alexa is horrible, and the app doesnt work fine
customer_reviews.author: Diego y Fiorella

customer_reviews.title: Great smart lock but Bluetooth is hard to set up
customer_reviews.text: I don’t have Alexa but it was easy to interstate into ADT and it was easy to install. I am satisfied and think it was worth it . Wayyyy better than Kwikset. A note about Bluetooth is I could not get it to work on a reliable basis. Is it me or the lock? Idk!
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Works fantastic with smart things
customer_reviews.text: Works fantastic with smart things, google home doesn’t support locks yet, but Alexa is able to lock the doors. With smart things I’ve setup a delay a motion sensor where after 20 minutes of no activity locks the doors.
customer_reviews.author: brandon

customer_reviews.title: Not working/No support response
customer_reviews.text: After a year of use, the integration with Apple Homekit spotted working. Tried to reach for Yale Support and got no response. Now don't know if the lock itself its damage or is just the iM1 damaged.
customer_reviews.author: George Reinoso

customer_reviews.title: Good lock, but batteries fail
customer_reviews.text: I have 5 of these locks around the house and batteries have to be replaced about every 3-4 months. Its driving me insane. Otherwise, no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Yoed

customer_reviews.title: Bought another one
customer_reviews.text: Negatives: Mobile app is junk and very confusing. Positives: Works reliably using Z-Wave + SmartThings Hub Easy to install Easy to add or update codes (on the physical lock itself)
customer_reviews.author: Chris J.

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I had a hard time biting the bullet and spending this much on a door lock, but now that I have it and installed it is FANTASTIC! Smart lock that links to my ZWave controller for remote access, Bluetooth feature works great, and the lock is SOLID!!!
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Goad

customer_reviews.title: Smooth as Silk.
customer_reviews.text: So far I'm very pleased with this product. Installation was stupid simple and went as smoothly as one could have wanted. Even the link to the phone was straight forward. Great job Yale!
customer_reviews.author: James H. Glasson

customer_reviews.title: Nice lock, easy to program.
customer_reviews.text: I set it to automatically relock, works great, never have to check the front door again! Works great with Wink too. Programming has voice prompts, no need to have the instructions in hand when making changes.
customer_reviews.author: Snazzy

customer_reviews.title: First off I haven't used it with a smart hub or tried to unlock/lock it through the wi-fi
customer_reviews.text: First off I haven't used it with a smart hub or tried to unlock/lock it through the wi-fi. But I do love the convenience of this lock. Super easy to install and program. Lots of keys available to supply to the household.
customer_reviews.author: Jesla

customer_reviews.title: Excellent !!!! Too easy to install and use .... WORKS PERFECTLY with SIRI and HOMEKIT (this model is for that)
customer_reviews.text: Excellent !!!! Too easy to install and use .... WORKS PERFECTLY with SIRI and HOMEKIT (this model is for that)
customer_reviews.author: Yuyo Saine

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works pretty good with smartthings. Was having some connection issues but appears to be working better now.
customer_reviews.author: Terrell

customer_reviews.title: It time to update your lock! Say Bye-Bye to your old keys!
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install.Like the color. Easy to use it. Love to have a human voice for guidance ( all my guest said it was a very cool ).
customer_reviews.author: user

customer_reviews.title: Great electronic lock for house (smaller than you think too)
customer_reviews.text: I use this almost daily to get in and out of my house, its great and works in cold weather the bluetooth works but the touch screen is the way to do it, it was also easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: Jlweber

customer_reviews.title: Very convenient and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this product for our second home . Great product, easier to program and easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: Robertbfxd

customer_reviews.title: Horrible App makes the lock a paper weight
customer_reviews.text: Lock is OK but the Assure app makes it unusable. Not worth the money. This will be the second Yale lock that I am returning.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen K

customer_reviews.title: Was missing hardware
customer_reviews.text: I ordered twice and each box was missing something different
customer_reviews.author: Nikita Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Great Smart Lock
customer_reviews.text: It’s a great lock just not the Yale’s app it sucks but I would look into getting the Apple HomeKit Enabled one
customer_reviews.author: Amartinez

customer_reviews.title: Reliable, peace of mind when on the road
customer_reviews.text: Works very reliably with Apple TV 4th Gen. Installation and setup very easy.
customer_reviews.author: NumberOneSon

customer_reviews.title: great product!
customer_reviews.text: works great. if you want to use with smart things you better get the z-wave version
customer_reviews.author: William Irizarry

customer_reviews.title: Keypad is great But if you want Bluetooth ease don't get this ...
customer_reviews.text: Keypad is great But if you want Bluetooth ease don't get this one Yea it's Bluetooth if your standing in front of it and twist your phone However still must push the check on screen
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: A little hard to set up but works great with my phone and smart things app
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Complicated, Poor Customer Support.
customer_reviews.text: My lock showed low battery and lost the connection to my App. I replaced the battery and then also it didn’t show up in the App. I tried resetting it but then the lock itself stopped to work. I tried calling their customer support and they didn’t reply either. No online manual was useful.
customer_reviews.author: Hdxt

customer_reviews.title: Performance
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product, easy to install, it took me less than 15 minutes to install. Easy to add the codes and works fantastic with my iPhone when remotely operated.
customer_reviews.author: gabriel corrales

customer_reviews.title: very limited
customer_reviews.text: Very limited functions. Pretty much Alexa can lock the door and that's it.
customer_reviews.author: allydog

customer_reviews.title: Great quality built
customer_reviews.text: Great quality built, nice instructions. The bt Yale app is awful, but I use it with the codes and zwave, it all works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Sebastian Perez Paz

customer_reviews.title: Does not connect to wifi
customer_reviews.text: I thought it connect to my nest app. It doesn’t. Install was ok. I finally got it to connect to WiFi. Had to purchase a home connect. Goes in the lock. I love the lock. Just cost a 130 more the. I thought.
customer_reviews.author: michael r witte

customer_reviews.title: Looks great.
customer_reviews.text: Very convenient.no more lost keys.quality product.works as it should be.would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Overall good purchase
customer_reviews.text: Lock is a great product. Easy install. I use the zwave and works great through that. Yale app is not the best but I don't use it. My only con is it drains batteries too quick. Might be the zwave&blutooth module.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and setup.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install and setup. My SmartThings hub recognized it immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Tinnel

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice finishing, good quality. Bluetooth did not work though ... no interaction with my iPhone
customer_reviews.author: nelson astur neto

customer_reviews.title: Work just ok
customer_reviews.text: After install connected to my home network with Samsung SmartThing and incorporate into Google Mini, work very well for few day, after that Google will not recognize the device but I still able to control with Samsung SmartThing app manually. Then I try ti setup the with the Yale app and the app asked me to enter mater key then press 8 on the menu, but there is not 8 on the menu. After some research and find out the unit I got is not a Bluetooth unit even the model on the box is state Bluetooth. Will return to exchange and will update later
customer_reviews.author: Davidson

customer_reviews.title: Does not work easily.
customer_reviews.text: Could never get key on phone to unlock as advertised. This is the 3rd lock of this type I have purchased. 1st with Bluetooth. Does not work as advertised. Instructions for setup are difficult to understand. I could never get unit to unlock from my phone.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna M. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Manual mode is good, but phone operation not so much.
customer_reviews.text: The lock itself is good. The app is too cumbersome to bother with.
customer_reviews.author: Walter F Happell

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love my Yale lock... easy to install...No more keys
customer_reviews.author: Nezayork

customer_reviews.title: nice looking lock and used exiting door knob it worked ...
customer_reviews.text: nice looking lock and used exiting door knob it worked just fine.As far as install needed help with that.programming the keypad is frustrating make sure to follow directions.call the help line they include .Still cant get keys on my phone to sync with lock.Thats ok it takes longer to take your phone out of your pocket and go on the yale app.just enter your code at the lock its faster
customer_reviews.author: silver350

customer_reviews.title: Love the Yale assure lock
customer_reviews.text: Love the Yale assure lock. Make sure to download the app to show you how to install step by step. Very easy to use and set up!
customer_reviews.author: Yang Pei Liu

customer_reviews.title: Caution: This device must be intalled in entrance with ...
customer_reviews.text: Caution: This device must be intalled in entrance with alternate acces. The design without key or out acces be a problem. In my case I need cross by the next apartment window at 10 floors. The master key work ok, but the twist remain in closepotition.
customer_reviews.author: Hcarrascal

customer_reviews.title: Total junk
customer_reviews.text: Does not work. Customer support only accepts calls during normal work hours. Guess what. It's Saturday and they are closed.
customer_reviews.author: roachpatty

customer_reviews.title: So so....
customer_reviews.text: The lock seems to be OK so far. The app on the other hand is horrendous. It is too slow to even think about using. The twist and go feature only works about half the time. The product has potential, but isn't ready for prime time yet.
customer_reviews.author: BG

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Bluetooth does not work well, get the one with internet.
customer_reviews.author: Parker12

customer_reviews.title: The lock we received is defective. We were just ...
customer_reviews.text: The lock we received is defective. We were just told to send it back by Yale's technical support, but the window has closed.
customer_reviews.author: aka6810

customer_reviews.title: Over priced and Garbage.
customer_reviews.text: As a keypad entry. It works OK. Bluetooth is not working. After 5 keys, they charge you $2 per key. Their app is not intuitive. DON'T BUY ANY OF YALE PRODUCTS! CAVEAT EMPETOR!
customer_reviews.author: K. Weso

customer_reviews.title: Product was not same as description
customer_reviews.text: The product I ordered was not what I received. My builder installed the lock. I did receive the zwave chip with it, but there was no place in the lock to install it. The instructions where about a similar item. Since I installed it, I will continually use it and it works, but I have no way to link it to my home automation system. Since I cannot go without a lock on my house, I cant return it and wait for the right one to come in.
customer_reviews.author: Rodney B Walker

customer_reviews.title: Be careful if you are looking for SmartThings Compatibility
customer_reviews.text: Be careful of the model number. I was sent a product that does not pair with Samsung SmartThings and is not Z Wave or Zigbee compatible. This product page falsely advertises a better product then the one you'll receive.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Langenfeld

customer_reviews.title: NOT A WIFI LOCK
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. We got this for our vacation rental home. Only to find out we CAN'T use the Wifi - passwords unless we install a HUB and some other add on item purchased separately. These other items will set you back $200 to use this lock via wifi. Which means you Have to be near the door to update via BLUETOOTH only. Be aware. We researched these smart locks and everything that is advertised, doesn't tell you exactly what is needed to make this door lock work with Wifi remotely.
customer_reviews.author: Bri00

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice quality, however it cost $2 to have shareable e-key
customer_reviews.author: Allen

customer_reviews.title: No more keys
customer_reviews.text: Love my new lock. Works great. I love how I can give my family, their own code. Installation was easy. My son is planning to get one.
customer_reviews.author: Estela Alfaro

product_meta.title: Yale Security YRD246-iM1-619 Assure LOCK Yale Assure LOCK Key Free with IM1 Network Module (Homekit-Enabled) In (YRD246), Satin Nickel
product_meta.description: Color Name:Satin Nickel| Style:HomeKit (iM1)Lock and unlock your home without the hassle of keys - enter your 4-8 digit entry code on the touchscreen keypad, use the Apple Home app or simply ask Siri! You'll never need to share a key again, simply create unique entry codes for friends and family and manage them within the Yale Secure app. The lock fits standard doors 1 3/4 inch to 2 1/4 inch thick with face bore holes of 2 1/8 inch and can be installed with just a screwdriver.
feature_bullets: Lock and unlock your door using your iPhone, siri voice commands or by entering your 4-8 digit pin code on the touchscreen keypad
Manage your lock from anywhere when you have an Apple TV 4TH GEN or later or iPad running iOS10.3 or later set up as a home hub
Manage 25 unique pin codes in the free app to share with friends and family
100% key free with a 9V battery back-up to prevent lock-outs
Installs on doors with just a screwdriver; fits 1-3/4 inch to 2-1/4 inch thick doors

specifications.Included Components: Yale Secure App Quick Start Guide, Installation Manual, Yale iM1 Network Module, Mounting Hardware and Deadbolt, Door Template, Yale Assure Lock Key Free, 4 AA Batteries
specifications.Warranty Description: Lifetime Limited Warranty Finish and Mechanical; 1 Year Electronic
specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.6 out of 5 stars365 ratings3.6 out of 5 stars
